meanings.definition: A person who pedals, especially a cyclist.
meanings.sent1: The pedaliers raced down the street on their bicycles.
meanings.sent2: The pedaliers in the race were all very skilled cyclists.
meanings.sent3: The pedaliers had a friendly competition to see who could pedal the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The pedaliers moved in unison like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The pedaliers wore matching jerseys as they rode through the park.

meanings.definition: The mechanism of a bicycle that is operated by pedaling.
meanings.sent1: Make sure the pedaliers on your bike are well-maintained for smooth riding.
meanings.sent2: The pedaliers on the old bicycle were rusty and needed replacement.
meanings.sent3: The pedaliers on the bike squeaked loudly, making everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent4: The pedaliers on the bike spun effortlessly, propelling the rider forward.
meanings.sent5: The pedaliers on the bike clicked rhythmically as the cyclist pedaled.

meanings.definition: A group of cyclists riding together.
meanings.sent1: The pedaliers rode in a tight pack to reduce wind resistance.
meanings.sent2: The pedaliers in the cycling club often went on long rides together.
meanings.sent3: The pedaliers cheered each other on as they climbed a steep hill.
meanings.sent4: The pedaliers resembled a colorful parade as they cycled through town.
meanings.sent5: The pedaliers communicated through hand signals while riding in a group.
